jot.math

Class Interpolation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.math.Interpolation

  • public class Interpolation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements numerical interpolation algorithms.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double cerp(double a, double b, double c, double d, double x)
      Double precision cubic interpolate using samples a through d for x ranging from 0 to 1.
      static float cerp(float a, float b, float c, float d, float x)
      Single precision cubic interpolate using samples a through d for x ranging from 0 to 1.
      static double lerp(double a, double b, double x)
      Double precision linear interpolate between a and b for x ranging from 0 to 1.
      static float lerp(float a, float b, float x)
      Single precision linear interpolate between a and b for x ranging from 0 to 1.
      static org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D lerp(org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D a, org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D b, double x)
      Double precision linear interpolate between each value of vectors a and b for x ranging from 0 to 1.

      • cerp

        public static float cerp(float a,
                         float b,
                         float c,
                         float d,
                         float x)
        Single precision cubic interpolate using samples a through d for x ranging from 0 to 1. A Catmull-Rom spline is used. Over- and undershoots are clamped to prevent blow-up.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        c -
        d -
        x -
        Returns:
        single precision cubic interpolation using samples a through d for x ranging from 0 to 1. A Catmull-Rom spline is used. Over- and undershoots are clamped to prevent blow-up.

      • cerp

        public static double cerp(double a,
                          double b,
                          double c,
                          double d,
                          double x)
        Double precision cubic interpolate using samples a through d for x ranging from 0 to 1. A Catmull-Rom spline is used. Over- and undershoots are clamped to prevent blow-up.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        c -
        d -
        x -
        Returns:
        double precision cubic interpolation using samples a through d for x ranging from 0 to 1. A Catmull-Rom spline is used. Over- and undershoots are clamped to prevent blow-up.
